messages: aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:24): ok need advice
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:25): I work for a company with clients still say want their site to support ie6
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:25): I've been working ie6 in 2010 and before
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:25): and this new year i refuse to support the browser
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:25): but here's the catch, it's my job
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:25): what should i do?
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:26): as in i'm fine with building sites ie7 and up, ff, chrome etc
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:26): you could either not fight and keep supporting, or create a valid concise arguement as to why IE6 is seriously irrelevant anymore
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:26): what if they say, we don't agree
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:26): insert arguements like development time needed to fix all the issues, increased resources etc
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:27): can I say, fine then get someone to fix those ie6 issues\
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:27): cuz im not
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:27): if you want to risk it
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:27): it's effin' stupid though.. damn
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:28): why do i need to explain to not build sites for a browser that's 10 years old?
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:28): it becomes an argument with fools
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:28): because it has a long history of still being around
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:28): and the person fixing is me at the end of day.. and i'm done with it
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:28): i'm sick of it
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:28): loll
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:29): like i said, present a solid arguement against it, and present
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:29): er, take off that end part :D i repeated myself
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:29): hmm.. i'll see
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:30): fuckin ie9 is out now
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:30): the first bit was getting people off of IE6, now it's turning into a case of getting people off of XP
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:31): so that they can get upgraded to IE9
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:32): that's going to be the harder part, imho
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:33): blah
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:34): i just want to say "Guys I don't fix for ie6 anymore, cheers" lol
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:34): they should be happy i'm still doing ie7
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:34): anyway, i'll see what to do
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:34): all a matter of convincing the client
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:34): don't forget to monitor visitor traffic
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:35): see how many people are actually using it
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:36): i could care less about that, in the U.S. it's less than 2%
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:36): that's what matters
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:36): i don't live in China
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:36): personally, i wouldn't feel bad about offending 50 people with a bad lookin website
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:36): it's stupid obvious
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:36): China is the only country that can argue lol
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:37): honestly, with my personal traffic, that'd be a lot of people, but if they get 1000s daily or so, 50 isn't much
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:40): i'm just not afraid to offend a small handful of people
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:41): the people going to your site
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:41): or the client
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:41): which one?
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:41): and actually i have no contact with client
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:42): well, sites
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:42): i work for a company that has clients
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:42): ohok
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:42): if i could, i'd offend the "potential customers" too
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (02:44): gotcha
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:48): you could get flat out arrogant "if you're using that browser, i don't want your business"
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (02:48): at least for the personal level
b039bf7315033fd5e12b05e8894ff3f9 (03:05): I'm about to put log output stream on a html5 page. How do I do that best? And to make sure the most lower item is always shown?
